verses.roman:
amṛta-maṇḍā, saravatī, āra kumḍā-kurī
sarāmṛta, sarabhājā, āra sarapurī

synonyms: amṛta-maṇḍā—a variety of papaya; saravatī—a kind of orange; āra—and; kumḍā-kurī—crushed squash; sarāmṛta—cream; sara-bhājā—fried cream; āra—and; sara-purī—a kind of purī made with cream.
translation: There were also papayas and saravatī, a type of orange, and also crushed squash. There was also regular cream, fried cream and a type of purī made with cream.
